text: hi I'm Erica and welcome back to a new

at some business negotiation idioms
so some idioms which are related to
negotiations now when it comes to

that you need to possess is to negotiate
and what does that really mean well to
negotiate it means it's a dialogue
between two people or two parties
intended to come to an agreement and in
the corporate world you might have come
across many people using different
idioms related to negotiations so that's
what we are going to learn today so that
it helps you to negotiate with people in
order to negotiate your salary or a
promotion or to secure a sale or to form
a new partnership so let's get started
the first one that we have over here is
above bowed now when it comes to
business negotiations and we end up
saying that for example our dealings are
above bowed it means that your dealings
are honest legal and open so probably
you are having a meeting with another
party okay with whom you are doing a
business and you end up saying that you
know our dealings have always been above
bowed it means you are trying to say
that we have always been honest open and
legal so all your dealings are honest
open and legal and that's exactly the
reason why you would end up using this
idiom so hope that's helpful to you
let's look at another one here
and over backwards now when you bend
over backwards it means that you try
very hard to do something in order to
please someone so for example your
customer or your client is an extremely
important client for you okay and you
really want to try very hard in order to
keep them happy in order to please them
then this is the right idiom that you
can use you can say to keep business
with you we would always bend over
backwards it means that you would really
work hard to please them okay the next
one here is blank cheque now we all know
what's a blank cheque well I'm not
talking about the bank cheque but I'm
talking about blank cheque wherein
someone gives an authority or gives a

decisions so probably a boss would
authorize this colleague or his business
partner to take a decision of their own
okay so probably whatever the situation
is and whatever the business partner
thinks is right for the business then he
would go ahead and take the decision so
which means his boss or his business
partner has given him a blank check okay
so a blank check is when you authorize
or you give permission
so when you give authority to someone to
take their own decisions okay so that's
when you give a blank check to someone
so for example mr. John Smith gave a
blank check to David to decide on the

he asked David to take his own decision
according to the situation okay now
let's have a look at another one
bide your time now bind your time it
means when you wait quietly and
patiently for a good opportunity to do
something so probably you don't want to
end up making hasty decisions or you
don't want to be impulsive you want to
wait patiently okay for a good
opportunity so that means you bide your
time okay
so it's not that you are hesitating
probably you're waiting for the prices
to go down so you bide your time so it
means to wait for a good opportunity
okay so that's bide your time for you
the next one is blow a deal well to blow
a deal it means to ruin a deal so
probably you are into business with
someone and by saying something or by
doing something you totally blow the
deal it means you have totally ruined
the business deal
so probably your partner's had a word
with a different party okay a different
client and they said something that
really didn't make the others happy
about it
so it means that they ruined the
business deal okay they blowed the deal
so which means they didn't get the
contract or they didn't get the business
with that party okay so that's when you
can use this idiom let's have a look at
another one here is get the raw end of
the deal now when you get the raw end of
the deal it means you did a very bad job
in negotiating which means that you have
got the very bad part of the deal so for
example you end up negotiating with one
of your business partners about a
business contract and they end up giving
you the contract but they say that we
would not use your company's name on a
product so this means it's not a good
deal for you right you did a bad job in
negotiating you got the draw end of the
deal which means you got the bad part of
the deal or it's not a good deal so when
the deal is really bad okay it's not
profitable doesn't make your company
happy it means you've got the wrong end
of the deal and then let's have a look
at the last one here come to terms now
come to terms very simple it means to

understanding so probably um you are
having a discussion with one of the

of negotiating between the parties they
come to terms like y'all come to terms
it means that you come to an agreement
okay you come to an understanding you

dear come to terms okay so how these
